headline: Nvidia Stock At Key Level As Magnificent Seven Earnings Loom
summary: Nvidia stock slipped but held a key level on Tuesday as Big Tech earnings are set to roll in.  The broader AI trade recently received a lift after Nvidia Chief Executive Jensen Huang said demand is "really, really high" for Nvidia's Blackwell graphics processing units.  Is Nvidia stock a buy or sell now?

headline: Mag 7 Earnings Could Spark a Year-End Surge. What the Charts of Meta, Google, Amazon Say.
summary: After a brief pause, one of the market’s key leadership groups, the Magnificent Seven, is firming up again.  All components except  Nvidia  are scheduled to report earnings by the end of next week, and those results could set the tone for a year-end rally.  The stock broke out of a bull flag formation to close at a new all-time high.

The stock broke out of a bull flag formation to close at a new all-time high.

headline: Keysight Enables SK hynix to Achieve Top-Tier OCP S.A.F.E. Evaluation for Solid-State Drive Solution
summary: SANTA ROSA, Calif., October 21, 2025--Keysight Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: KEYS) has enabled SK hynix to earn its first Open Compute Project (OCP) Security Appraisal Framework and Enablement (S.A.F.E.) recognition for a solid-state drive (SSD) solution. This accomplishment represents a pioneering industry collaboration, underscoring Keysight’s commitment to empowering innovators and securing the technology supply chain.

headline: Trinity Cyber Welcomes Shawn Turskey to Advisory Board as Company Accelerates Remarkable Growth
summary: Trinity Cyber, Inc., the preemptive cybersecurity pioneer, today announced that Shawn Turskey, a distinguished cybersecurity leader, has joined its Advisory Board. This appointment comes as Trinity Cyber rapidly scales to meet demand for its active cyber defense solution, solidifying its position as a category-defining company in the $200+ billion global cybersecurity market.

headline: Does NVIDIA's (NVDA) Desktop AI Supercomputer Shift the Long-Term Growth Outlook?
summary: NVIDIA has begun shipping the DGX Spark, a compact AI supercomputer developed in partnership with MediaTek, enabling developers to locally prototype and fine-tune large AI models using the ultra-efficient GB10 Grace Blackwell Superchip. This advancement, along with new client integrations like Meta and Oracle standardizing NVIDIA networking technologies, dramatically expands access to scalable, high-performance AI development beyond traditional cloud or data center environments. We’ll...
